It‚Äôs not easy being the Pigeon-you never get to do ANYTHING! But when the Bus Driver has a crisis that threatens to make her passengers (gasp!) late, maybe that wily bird CAN do something. description:

As a founding member of Buffalo Springfield, Poco, and Loggins & Messina, his genre-defining contributions to rock, country rock, and folk continue to influence artists across generations.

From producing and performing alongside Kenny Loggins to crafting enduring classics like ‚ÄúYour Mama Don‚Äôt Dance,‚Äù ‚ÄúPeace of Mind,‚Äù and ‚ÄúAngry Eyes,‚Äù Messina‚Äôs work has earned platinum records, sold-out tours, and a devoted following. His solo performances are a journey through the golden age of California rock‚Äîfilled with rich harmonies, masterful guitar work, and heartfelt storytelling.

Whether you know him from his chart-topping collaborations or his trailblazing work with some of music‚Äôs biggest names, Jim Messina‚Äôs live performance is a masterclass in songwriting, musicianship, and legacy.

description:
A quirky and hilarious farmyard musical.

Cows that type? Hens on strike? Whoever heard of such a thing!  
   
 In *Click, Clack, Moo*, based on the Caldecott Honor Book by Doreen Cronin and Betsy Lewin, the barnyard is buzzing when Farmer Brown‚Äôs granddaughter leaves her laptop in the cold. The cows use it to demand electric blankets‚Äîand when the answer is no, they go on strike, with the chickens right behind them. What follows is a hilariously heartwarming tale of negotiation and compromise, set to toe-tapping music by Brad Alexander, winner of the prestigious Richard Rodgers Award.

Praised as *‚Äúclever, fun, and full of heart‚Ä¶ a delightful introduction to musical theatre‚Äù* by Time Out NY Kids, and hailed by Parenting Magazine for delivering *‚Äúa message even the youngest audience members will understand: cooperation and compromise are powerful tools,‚Äù* this musical mooooooovement is perfect for your little farm hand.

**Approximate Running Time:** 60 minutes

**Recommended Ages:** 4 ‚Äì 7

event: The Stinky Cheese Man & Other Fairly Stupid Tales
description:
Classic fairy tales get a silly makeover in this fast-paced, family-friendly show full of laughs and surprises.

Hold onto your noses and your funny bones! Griffin Theatre Company‚Äôs uproarious adaptation of *The Stinky Cheese Man & Other Fairly Stupid Tales* turns classic fairy tales upside-down and inside-out. Jack (yes, the beanstalk guy) is on the run from a hungry Giant, but his escape is constantly thwarted by a cast of zany characters‚Äîincluding a loaf-obsessed Little Red Hen and the notoriously smelly Stinky Cheese Man.

This fast-paced, 60-minute show is a whirlwind of fractured fairy tales where Cinderella snubs Rumpelstiltskin, the Ugly Duckling stays ugly, and the Tortoise challenges a hair-growing Hare. With witty narration, playful set designs, and a healthy dose of absurdity, this production is a treat for kids and adults alike.

**Approximate Running Time:** 60 minutes
